description: The Ghana Government Scholarship, administered by the Ghana Scholarships Secretariat, offers financial assistance to brilliant but needy Ghanaian students pursuing tertiary education. The scholarship supports both local and international studies in various disciplines, aiming to develop human capital for national development.
application_deadline: Varies annually; typically between April and September. Specific dates are announced on the official portal.
eligibility_requirements: Ghanaian citizen with a valid Ghana Card or national ID.
Gained admission and enrolled in an accredited tertiary institution (public or private) in Ghana or abroad.
Demonstrated academic merit (e.g., excellent WASSCE results for undergraduates).
Demonstrated financial need.
Not currently benefiting from any other government scholarship.
benefits: Monthly stipends for living expenses (for international studies).
application_process: Visit the official application portal: [www.apply.scholarships.gov.gh](https://www.apply.scholarships.gov.gh/).
Create an account using a valid email address and phone number.
Complete the online application form with accurate personal, academic, and financial information.
Upload required documents: admission letter, academic transcripts, Ghana Card, passport-sized photo, proof of financial need.
Submit the application for district-level review.
Attend a district-level interview if shortlisted.
Await notification of award status via SMS, email, or the application portal.
Successful applicants will receive electronic award letters and instructions for fund disbursement.
amount: Varies based on program and study location; typically covers full tuition and additional allowances.

amount: Varies based on program and study location; typically covers full tuition and additional allowances.

description: The JEQ Foundation Scholarship provides full tuition and housing support to academically outstanding but financially disadvantaged students enrolled in accredited colleges and universities in Ghana. Established in 2019, the foundation aims to empower students through education, mentorship, and career development opportunities.
application_deadline: September 29, 2024
eligibility_requirements: Ghanaian citizen enrolled in a recognized college or university in Ghana (online education excluded).
Minimum CGPA of 3.3 (Second-Class Upper Division).
For incoming students: must have graduated from Senior High School with at least 4As and 4Bs in the WAEC exams and obtained an official admission letter from an accredited institution.
Demonstrated financial need: combined monthly parental income less than 600 GHS or single-parent income less than 400 GHS.
Submission of official academic documents, including admission letter, transcript, tuition sheet, and housing fees.
Personal essay (300–500 words) and recent passport-sized photo.
Three (3) recommendation letters: two from current professors/lecturers and one from a non-family member.
For orphans: submission of death certificate and guardian documents.
benefits: Full tuition and housing support for the duration of the undergraduate program.
Provision of laptops to selected students.
Academic advising, mentorship, and internship opportunities.
Encouragement of community service (minimum 15 hours per year) and future contributions to the foundation.
application_process: Visit the official application portal: [jequansahfoundation.org/apply](https://www.jequansahfoundation.org/apply).
Complete the online application form with accurate personal, academic, and financial information.
Upload required documents: admission letter, academic transcripts, tuition and housing invoices, personal essay, passport-sized photo, and recommendation letters.
Email the application and documents to quansahfoundation@gmail.com on the same day of submission.
Deadline for submission: September 29, 2024.
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted in early November 2024.
amount: Covers full tuition and housing fees; additional support includes laptop provision and academic resources.

description: The Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program at KNUST provides young Africans from economically disadvantaged communities with access to quality and relevant education. The program emphasizes leadership development, community engagement, and academic excellence.
application_deadline: Annually, typically by May 30
eligibility_requirements: Ghanaian citizen
Demonstrated financial need
Strong academic record
Commitment to community service
application_process: Submit an online application through the KNUST Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program portal
Provide academic transcripts, recommendation letters, and proof of financial need
Participate in interviews and selection processes
amount: Full scholarship covering tuition, accommodation, stipends, and other allowances

scholarship_name: Ashesi University Financial Aid and Scholarships
description: Ashesi University offers financial aid and scholarships to students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds. The Ashesi Scholarship Fund provides partial or full scholarships covering tuition and housing costs.
application_deadline: Rolling admissions; priority applications by March 31
eligibility_requirements: Ghanaian citizen
Demonstrated financial need
Strong academic performance
Commitment to leadership and community service
application_process: Complete the online application form available on the Ashesi University website
Submit required documents including academic transcripts, essays, and recommendation letters
Financial need assessment form submission
amount: Varies; typically partial to full tuition and housing support
